intro: Viorna crispa var. walteri, commonly known as the Walter's crinkled bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, crinkled leaves and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
